Intel's newest processors are now into production and making a risky bet: that graphics chips, not specialised neural engines, are the future of AI computing. That‚Äôs early benchmarks though.Panther Lake runs on Intel's 18A process‚Äîthe first 2-nanometer technology designed and manufactured entirely on American soil. The company's new Xe 3 graphics architecture delivers 120 trillion operations per second for AI tasks‚Äînearly double the previous generation. The NPU barely budged, inching from 48 to 50 TOPS.Panther Lake will power everything from laptops to industrial robots, and the first products will roll out in January 2026.Intel‚Äôs also making a 288-core server chip, dubbed Clearwater Forest, that‚Äôs made on the same 2-nanometer manufacturing process and is also launching next year.

Article Title: Discord data breach: Company says 70,000 users' government IDs leaked
Article Text:
Hackers demand ransom as extortion attempt unfolds

Platform revokes vendor access, works with law enforcement





Discord has identified approximately 70,000 users whose government-issued ID photos may have been exposed following a security incident involving a third-party customer service provider. The breach, discovered in late September, targeted the platform's age verification system used to review appeals from users.The San Francisco-based company emphasised this was not a direct breach of Discord's systems, but rather a compromise of an external vendor supporting customer service operations. Affected users have been contacted via email from noreply@discord.com, with Discord clarifying it will not reach out by phone regarding this incident.The unauthorised party targeted the customer support services to access user data with the intention of extorting a financial ransom from Discord. Claims circulating online suggest attackers possess significantly more data than Discord has acknowledged, but the company maintains these numbers are inflated as part of the extortion scheme.Compromised information may include usernames, email addresses, contact details, limited billing information including the last four digits of credit cards, IP addresses, and messages exchanged with customer service agents.Full credit card numbers, passwords, and Discord messages beyond customer support conversations were not accessed.Discord immediately revoked the customer support provider's access to its ticketing system upon discovering the attack. The company has engaged a leading computer forensics firm to support investigation and remediation efforts while working closely with law enforcement and data protection authorities.Discord, which boasts more than 200 million users worldwide, serves as a messaging platform popular with gamers for chatting and sharing files within the gaming community. The company has not named the compromised third-party vendor involved in the breach.
Article Summary: Discord identified 70,000 users whose government-issued ID photos may have been exposed following a security incident involving a third-party customer service provider. Nvidia H20 Chips for China: What‚Äôs Really Going On?

China has tightened its rare earth export controls, expanding restrictions on processing technology and spelling out its intention to limit exports to overseas defence and semiconductor users. The tightening of controls comes weeks ahead of a face-to-face meeting between Presidents Donald Trump and Xi Jinping in South Korea.Indian companies have also submitted end-user certificates stating that rare Earth magnets will not be used for manufacturing any weapons of mass destruction. Beijing is also reported to have sought export control guarantees on the lines of the Wassenaar Arrangement. China is not a signatory to the agreement, which promotes transparency and responsibility in the transfer of dual-use technologies and goods among the 42 member states for the purposes of international security.
